com.engineersbox.httpproxy.formatting.http

Interface BaseHTTPFormatter<T extends HTTPStartLine>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Instance of HTTPStartLine indicating whether the message is a request or response
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HTTPFormatter

    public interface BaseHTTPFormatter<T extends HTTPStartLine>
    Base interface for a converter to take a raw RFC 2616 Section 4 compliant message in the format of String or byte[] and convert it to a HTTPMessage

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HTTPMessage<T> fromRaw(byte[] raw, byte[] bodyBytes, java.nio.charset.Charset charset, java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
      Convert a byte[] into a HTTPMessage.
      HTTPMessage<T> fromRaw(byte[] raw, java.nio.charset.Charset charset, java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
      Convert a byte[] into a HTTPMessage.
      HTTPMessage<T> fromRawString(java.lang.String raw, byte[] bodyBytes, java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
      Convert a String into a HTTPMessage.
      HTTPMessage<T> fromRawString(java.lang.String raw, java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
      Convert a String into a HTTPMessage.

    • Method Detail

      • fromRaw

        HTTPMessage<T> fromRaw(byte[] raw,
                       java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                       java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
                throws InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException,
                       InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException,
                       InvalidHTTPVersionException,
                       InvalidHTTPHeaderException,
                       InvalidHTTPBodyException
        Convert a byte[] into a HTTPMessage. This will encode the body into a string and store the raw bytes separately. The encoded string will use the supplied Charset as its basis.
        Parameters:
        raw - byte[] representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4 compliant message
        charset - Charset to use as the encoding for the string representation of the body
        classOfT - Instance of HTTPStartLine to indicate whether this is a request or response
        Returns:
        A HTTPMessage
        Throws:
        InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException - Division of headers and body is invalid
        InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException - Start line for the request or response is invalid
        InvalidHTTPVersionException - Version is unsupported or invalid
        InvalidHTTPHeaderException - Headers are invalid or of the wrong format
        InvalidHTTPBodyException - Body exceeds the max size relative to configuration supplies in a Config

      • fromRaw

        HTTPMessage<T> fromRaw(byte[] raw,
                       byte[] bodyBytes,
                       java.nio.charset.Charset charset,
                       java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
                throws InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException,
                       InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException,
                       InvalidHTTPVersionException,
                       InvalidHTTPHeaderException,
                       InvalidHTTPBodyException
        Convert a byte[] into a HTTPMessage. This will encode the body into a string and store the raw bytes separately. The encoded string will use the supplied Charset as its basis.
        Parameters:
        raw - byte[] representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4 compliant message
        bodyBytes - byte[] representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4.3 compliant message body
        charset - Charset to use as the encoding for the string representation of the body
        classOfT - Instance of HTTPStartLine to indicate whether this is a request or response
        Returns:
        A HTTPMessage
        Throws:
        InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException - Division of headers and body is invalid
        InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException - Start line for the request or response is invalid
        InvalidHTTPVersionException - Version is unsupported or invalid
        InvalidHTTPHeaderException - Headers are invalid or of the wrong format
        InvalidHTTPBodyException - Body exceeds the max size relative to configuration supplies in a Config

      • fromRawString

        HTTPMessage<T> fromRawString(java.lang.String raw,
                             java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
                      throws InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException,
                             InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException,
                             InvalidHTTPVersionException,
                             InvalidHTTPHeaderException,
                             InvalidHTTPBodyException
        Convert a String into a HTTPMessage. This will encode the body into a string and store the raw bytes separately. Note that the raw bytes will retrieved from the supplied string using String.getBytes()
        Parameters:
        raw - String representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4 compliant message
        classOfT - Instance of HTTPStartLine to indicate whether this is a request or response
        Returns:
        A HTTPMessage
        Throws:
        InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException - Division of headers and body is invalid
        InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException - Start line for the request or response is invalid
        InvalidHTTPVersionException - Version is unsupported or invalid
        InvalidHTTPHeaderException - Headers are invalid or of the wrong format
        InvalidHTTPBodyException - Body exceeds the max size relative to configuration supplies in a Config

      • fromRawString

        HTTPMessage<T> fromRawString(java.lang.String raw,
                             byte[] bodyBytes,
                             java.lang.Class<T> classOfT)
                      throws InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException,
                             InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException,
                             InvalidHTTPVersionException,
                             InvalidHTTPHeaderException,
                             InvalidHTTPBodyException
        Convert a String into a HTTPMessage. This will encode the body into a string and store the raw bytes separately.
        Parameters:
        raw - String representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4 compliant message
        bodyBytes - byte[] representation of a RFC 2616 Section 4.3 compliant message body
        classOfT - Instance of HTTPStartLine to indicate whether this is a request or response
        Returns:
        A HTTPMessage
        Throws:
        InvalidHTTPMessageFormatException - Division of headers and body is invalid
        InvalidHTTPStartLineFormatException - Start line for the request or response is invalid
        InvalidHTTPVersionException - Version is unsupported or invalid
        InvalidHTTPHeaderException - Headers are invalid or of the wrong format
        InvalidHTTPBodyException - Body exceeds the max size relative to configuration supplies in a Config
